newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila buyers seen attracted by U.S. corn, wheat.
newsitem.headline: Manila buyers seen attracted by U.S. corn, wheat.

text.p: Prospects of a further drop in U.S. corn and wheat prices are expected to lure back Philippine buyers into the market next week, Manila grains traders said on Friday.

Wheat prices dropped on Thursday after the United States Department of Agriculture said 1997 U.S. winter wheat production would total 1.604 billion bushels, higher than analysts' estimates of 1.579 billion.
"Expect Philippine buyers to take advantage of price dips next week," said an executive in a Philippine mill.
He expected U.S. wheat prices to align soon with European and Canadian wheat prices. For hard wheat, these are $5 to $10 lower than U.S. prices at present, he added.
Philippine hog and poultry farmers were also likely to be in the market due to a local shortage.
"Corn is getting scarce," said an official in a Philippine poultry firm.

The country's main corn harvest is expected in the third quarter but agriculture officials said prospects of a dry spell due to "El Nino" weather patterns in the Pacific Ocean might affect production.
Livestock farmers have projected the Philippine corn shortage at one to two million tonnes this year.
Traders said they were waiting for an announcement from a group of Philippine hog raisers which sought price quotes recently for the supply of at least 25,000 tonnes of U.S. corn.
Meanwhile, rice, soybean and soymeal buyers were expected to remain on the sidelines due to ample supplies.
Prevailing flour and corn prices in Manila in pesos:
Retail price of yellow corn per kg 9.64 9.60
Retail price of white corn per kg 9.64 9.70
